timeline.bodyText: I don't like to have a pom inheriting from a child module. I think it could be better to make all modules directly inherit from  build-bom instead of kogito-runtimes. Wdyt?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: Could you explain the reason for not liking it?
replies.author: mareknovotny

replies.bodyText:
I think it is misleading to have a parent module that is not coherent with module hierarchy expecially when you have to add/remove properties or dependency.
But probably it is mainly because I find strange that build-bom is both my parent  and my child :)
replies.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
well, this is not something new or too uncommon to maven project/world.
And build-bom is not actually child as it doesn't inherit the top level pom.xml just it is executed/called out from it.
replies.author: mareknovotny

replies.bodyText:
Yes with child I meant child from a "file system" perspective.
Personally I prefer Quarkus (and OptaPlanner) setup that is a bit different:

build-parent: inherit from root pom
root pom: it is inheriting from jboss-parent while we want to be agnostic so no parent here
all other modules (i.e. core): inherit directly or not from build-parent

Btw no strong opinion and thanks for the PR because it is a step forward with project configuration :)
replies.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
Yes with child I meant child from a "file system" perspective.
Personally I prefer Quarkus (and OptaPlanner) setup that is a bit different:
* [build-parent](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/build-parent/pom.xml#L5-L9): inherit from root pom

* [root pom](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/pom.xml#L6-L10): it is inheriting from jboss-parent while we want to be agnostic so no parent here


Do we really keep this not inheriting? I think this will be required for later, so I can bring this here too, thanks for pointing it up

* all other modules (i.e. [core](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/core/pom.xml#L5-L10)): inherit directly or not from `build-parent`


maybe they are not inheriting directly, but this is probably for a reason, it is not part of the build chain, just built as a leaf artifact in the repository?

Btw no strong opinion and thanks for the PR because it is a step forward with project configuration :)

That is fine to object with explaining why ;)
replies.author: mareknovotny

timeline.bodyText: What is the reason of this change? Do we expect any benefit using jboss-parent as parent?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
The jboss-parent sets all plugin versions. All jboss projects using it, including kie 7, optaplanner, quarkus, wildfly, ...
Forgetting to set one of the plugin versions causes non-reproducible builds.
Settings them ourselves is a PITA to keep them up to date. The jboss-parent guys do a pretty good job of keeping them up to date soon enough and without upgrading them too fast either.
replies.author: ge0ffrey
